GpioConfiguration
struct
GpioConfiguration
Types
Feature

GPIO Feature options. Determines how the pin will be used

UNUSED_FEATURE

0x00 - Pin is unused

GPIO_FEATURE

0x01 - Direct control of pin output state or to stream the state of the pin

PPS_FEATURE

0x02 - Pulse per second input or output

ENCODER_FEATURE

0x03 - Motor encoder/odometer input

EVENT_TIMESTAMP_FEATURE

0x04 - Precision event timestamping

UART_FEATURE

0x05 - UART data or control lines

GpioBehavior

GPIO Pin behavior

GPIO_UNUSED

0x00 - Pin is unused

GPIO_INPUT

0x01 - Pin will be an input

GPIO_OUTPUT_LOW

0x02 - Pin is an output initially in the LOW state

GPIO_OUTPUT_HIGH

0x03 - Pin is an output initially in the HIGH state

PpsBehavior

PPS Pin behavior

UNUSED

0x00 - Pin is unused

PPS_INPUT

0x01 - Pin will receive the pulse-per-second signal

PPS_OUTPUT

0x02 - Pin will transmit the pulse-per-second signal from the device

EncoderBehavior

Encoder Pin behavior

ENCODER_UNUSED

0x00 - Pin is unused

ENCODER_A

0x01 - Encoder A

ENCODER_B

0x02 - Encoder B

EventTimestampBehavior

Event Timestamp Pin behavior

TIMESTAMP_UNUSED

0x00 - Pin is unused

TIMESTAMP_RISING

0x01 - Rising edge will be timestamped

TIMESTAMP_FALLING

0x02 - Falling edge will be timestamped

TIMESTAMP_EITHER

0x03 - Both rising and falling edges will be timestamped

UartBehavior

UART Pin behavior Note: only one Transmit and one Receive pin can be configured per port pair (see documentation)

UART_UNUSED

0x00 - Pin is unused

UART_PORT2_TX

0x21 - UART port 2 transmit

UART_PORT2_RX

0x22 - UART port 2 receive

UART_PORT3_TX

0x31 - UART port 3 transmit

UART_PORT3_RX

0x32 - UART port 3 receive

PinModes

PinModes for the pinMode Bitfield

NONE

0x00 - Pin not set

OPEN_DRAIN

0x01 - The pin will be an open-drain output

PULLDOWN

0x02 - The pin will have an internal pull-down resistor enabled

PULLUP

0x04 - The pin will have an internal pull-up resistor enabled

Functions
pinModeValue
void pinModeValue(
uint8 
val
)

Gets or sets the underlying value for the pin mode bitfield

fromCommandResponse
static GpioConfiguration fromCommandResponse(
const 
MipFieldValues& 
responseValues,
uint8 
startIndex
= 
0
)

[static] Build a GpioConfiguration object from the read command response <MipFieldValues>.

Parameters
responseValues
const MipFieldValues&

<MipFieldValues> to populate the GpioConfiguration object

startIndex
uint8

default 0 - indicates the index at which to start reading from the responseValues. This should not need to be changed from the default value (0).

Types
GpioPinId

A uint8 representing logical GPIO pin IDs

GpioPinModeOptions

A vector of GpioConfiguration::PinModes representing masked pin modes

GpioBehaviorModes

A map of uint behavior ID, GpioPinModeOptions pairs

GpioFeatureBehaviors

A map of GpioConfiguration::Feature, GpioBehaviorModes pairs

GpioPinOptions

A map of uint GpioPinId, GpioFeatureBehaviors pairs

EventControlMode

Event control modes DISABLED  - 0x00 - Trigger is disabled ENABLED  - 0x01 - Trigger is enabled TEST  - 0x02 - Force the trigger into the active state TEST_PULSE - 0x03 - Force the trigger into the active state for one event cycle
